title: Solar Panel Repair: A Practical Overview
content:
The Significance of a Well - Functioning Solar Panel System​
Energy Savings​
One of the primary reasons people invest in solar panels is to save on energy costs. A properly functioning solar panel system can significantly reduce your monthly electricity bills. According to the National Renewable Energy Laboratory, on average, a residential solar panel system can save homeowners between ​
100−200 per month on electricity, depending on the size of the system and local electricity rates. Over the course of a year, this can amount to savings of ​
1,200−2,400. However, if your solar panels are not working correctly, you may not be reaping these full benefits. A malfunctioning system could produce less energy, or in some cases, no energy at all, leaving you with higher electricity bills.​
 
Environmental Impact​
Solar energy is a clean and renewable source of power. By using solar panels, you are reducing your carbon footprint and contributing to a more sustainable future. A typical residential solar panel system can offset between 3 - 4 tons of carbon dioxide emissions per year, which is equivalent to planting over 100 trees annually. But a faulty solar panel system may not be operating at peak efficiency, reducing its environmental benefits. Ensuring your solar panels are in good working condition is not only good for your wallet but also for the planet.​
 
Home Value​
Installing solar panels can increase the value of your home. Research by the Appraisal Institute shows that homes with solar panel systems sell for, on average, 4.1% more than comparable homes without solar panels. However, a broken or poorly maintained solar panel system may not add as much value, or in some cases, could even be a deterrent to potential buyers. Keeping your solar panels in optimal condition through regular maintenance and prompt repairs is crucial for maintaining and enhancing your home's value.​
 
Common Solar Panel Problems​
Panel Damage​
Solar panels are exposed to the elements, and over time, they can sustain damage. Hailstorms, strong winds, or even fallen branches can crack or break the panels. A cracked panel may not be able to generate electricity efficiently or may stop working altogether. In fact, a single cracked solar panel can reduce the overall energy output of a system by up to 10 - 20%, depending on its location within the array.​
 
Wiring Issues​
The wiring in a solar panel system is essential for transmitting the electricity generated by the panels to the inverter and then to your home or business. Loose connections, frayed wires, or corroded terminals can disrupt the flow of electricity. Wiring problems are often difficult to detect without professional equipment and can lead to a significant drop in the system's performance.​
 
Inverter Malfunctions​
The inverter is a crucial component of a solar panel system as it converts the direct current (DC) electricity generated by the panels into alternating current (AC) electricity that can be used in your home or business. Inverter malfunctions are common and can be caused by overheating, electrical surges, or component failures. When an inverter fails, the entire solar panel system may stop producing usable electricity.​
 
Soiling and Shading​
Dirt, dust, and debris can accumulate on the surface of solar panels over time, reducing their ability to absorb sunlight. Even a thin layer of dirt can decrease the energy output of solar panels by 5 - 10%. Additionally, shading from trees, nearby buildings, or other objects can also significantly reduce the performance of solar panels. A single shaded panel in an array can cause a cascading effect, reducing the output of the entire system.​

This advanced technology allows us to pinpoint problems quickly and accurately, saving you time and money.​
